result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Letter to Court from Atty Wilsnack
Upon the defendant's plea and prior to adjudication, defendant will enter into a Deferred Prosecution Agreement for a period of: 24 months

Defendant Nicholas A. Rivera in court with attorney Jon R Wilsnack.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CF14 & 15CF96 tracking together:
Atty Hendee states that the defendant will be entering into Treatment Court Program.    Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Ct. 1 in 15CF14 & Counts 1 & 2 of 15CF96.  Counts 3 & 4 in 15CF96 to be dismissed and read-in.    Upon the defendant's plea and prior to adjudication, defendant will enter into a Deferred Prosecution Agreement for a period of:  24 months with conditions on Ct. 1 in 15CF14. 
 Atty Wilsnack agrees.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Counts 1 & 2 of 15CF96.  Counts 3 & 4 in 15CF96 to be dismissed and read-in.
Court accepts defendant's plea on 15CF14 and approves and signs the 24 month DPA with conditions.

Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.  Atty Hendee asks the court to have jail commence forthwith.
Atty Wilsnack makes sentencing arguments and asks the court to have the jail report time to be Monday.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  15CF14:  TREATMENT COURT:
Withhold Sentence; 36 months Probation with conditions:
*12 months in the Marquette County Jail w/huber; 8 months will be stayed for the use of Treatment Court violations
  Report on January 6, 2017 by 7:00pm, clean & sober.
*Huber to include treatment purposes including treatment court
*Court Costs = $268.00
*DNA Sample + $250 Surcharge
*Restitution = $3,026.00 + $302.60 surcharge = $3,328.60; Joint and Several with Derek J. Martz 15CF13, Jacob J. Hardman 14CF97, Brian E. DeVore 14CF100, & Thomas S. Fraley 14CF101.
*Participation in and successful graduation from Marquette County Treatment Court
*Comply with any and all counseling recommended by the Agent
*Maintain full-time employment
*Establish a monthly payment plan for restitution as recommended by the Agent

15CF96:  Counts 1 & 2:  Court approves the 24 month DPA with conditions.
Counts 3 & 4 to be dismissed and read-in.

Set Treatment Court hearing.  Treatment Court Hearing scheduled for January 19, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Nicholas A. Rivera in court with attorney Jon R Wilsnack.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CF14 & 15CF96 tracking together:
Atty Wilsnack states that the parties are very close to resolution and asks for another return date.

BY THE COURT:  Reset return date
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for January 5, 2017 at 03:30 pm.  Return date scheduled for January 5, 2017 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Nicholas A. Rivera in court with attorney Jon R Wilsnack.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the defendant has applied for the Treatment Court program.  Atty Wilsnack asks for a reset.

BY THE COURT:   Reset
15CF14 & 15C96 tracking
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for November 3, 2016 at 03:30 pm.  Return date scheduled for November 3, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

for Adjournment of Return Date s/BNB/7-26-16
Return date on August 4, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Letter via fax to Judge Bult from Atty Jon R. Wilsnack dated 07-05-16

Attorney Jon R Wilsnack in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CF14 & 15CF96 tracking:
Atty Wilsnack does not know where his client is today; he was supposed to meet here today at 1:15.  Atty Wilsnack asks for one week stay of the warrant if one is requested.    Atty Hendee requests warrant based on defendant's failure to appear.  

BY THE COURT:  Warrant will issue; stay until the end of business on Tuesday, July 2nd.  Atty Wilsnack is to contact the court if he gets in contact with his client.
Return date on July 1, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Nicholas A. Rivera in court with attorney Jon R Wilsnack.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CF96 & 15CF14 tracking together:
  Atty Hendee states that in speaking with Atty Wilsnack; the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today in 15CF96.  Atty Wilsnack agrees and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause in 15CF96 that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Hendee files the information in 15CF96 with the Court.  Atty Wilsnack states that the Defendant received a copy of the information in 15CF96 and waives its reading.
Atty Wilsnack enters a Not Guilty plea.

BY THE COURT:  Not Guilty plea entered.
Set for Return.
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for July 1, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Preliminary hearing on May 4, 2016 at 10:00 am.
(Attorney SPD apppointed - resent Notices to include that attorney)
Preliminary hearing on May 4, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Nicholas A. Rivera not in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CF14 & 15CF96 tracking together:
Atty Hendee states that Atty Wilsnack had sent a letter asking to reset the matters; the State has no objection to that.

BY THE COURT:  Court has not seen the letter but will approve the reset.
Trial for 15CF14 to be taken off.
bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 4, 2016 at 10:00 am.

with conditions:

Defendant Nicholas A. Rivera in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states that bond needs to be set along with booking.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands.   Atty Hendee has no objection to a signature bond with conditions.

  BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions:
*Appear for booking today
*No contact with Tracy Dye or Margaret Dee

Court questions the defendant.  Defendant waives time limits for the Prelim.
BY THE COURT:  Time limits waived; set for Prelim.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 6, 2016 at 10:00 am.
